column5: YOU WILL FIND in the DIARIES a LOT of POLITICS AND EVEN MORE CATS     THE PERSON who MAKES the FIRST COMMENT WILL GET TWO CATS EVERY PERSON WHO COMMENTS WILL GET A CAT     RULES IN THE DIARY WHEN YOU FIND SOMETHING in the DIARY that you LIKE YOU CAN REPOST IT AS COMMENT in the DIARY  PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN Biden's expansive agenda represents the toppling of decades of Democratic orthodoxy on the economy and the role of government.It's a recognition that Democrats want more government intervention than ever — and a bet the GOP is too fractured to stop it. https://t.co/Shp56i4wzh  President Biden: "We're delivering assistance to tens of thousands of restaurants and bars across the country. Today we're sending out the first relief checks to 16000 hard hit restaurants with help for many more to follow. A lot more people are gonna be employed."  The Biden admin has announced the formal launch of its Scientific Integrity Task Force which will review the federal government's scientific policies to ensure they're free from inappropriate political influence. https://t.co/lx0jiqQEgz  MICHELLE OBAMA Michelle Obama to CBS: "You wanna hang out with us? Get your vaccine. Get all of it. Finish it up. And then we can talk. So I urge everybody out there within the sound of our voices please please get the vaccine. It's time."  RON KLAIN Ron Klain to Axios on HBO: "I don't think it's big government to fix the ten bridges in this country that are most economically significant and are in serious" disrepair."It's basic basic things that we're putting forward."  XAVIER BECERRA Health Secretary Xavier Becerra to CNN on the ban on gender-based health care discrimination: "You should not discriminate against people that includes those based on sexual orientation or gender identity. And when it comes to health care we want to make sure that's the case."  DHS Biden's DHS is launching a warning system to find domestic terrorism threats on public social media.The goal is to detect the sort of posts that seemed to predict the Jan. 6 Capitol attack but were missed by law enforcement. https://t.co/Rq66DjSZ3f  FDA Reuters: FDA AUTHORIZES PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE FOR EMERGENCY USE IN ADOLESCENTS  TREASURY TREASURY: Today the Treasury Department announced the launch of the Coronavirus State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds established by the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 to provide $350 billion in emergency funding for state local territorial and Tribal governments.  SEN. JON OSSOFF Sen. Jon Ossoff plans to offer an amendment to the For the People Act that would ban states from restricting volunteers from giving food or water to Americans waiting in line to vote as long as it's offered to all voters.https://t.co/XvmAZ1NagS  SEN. ED MARKEY & RICHARD BLUMENTHAL Sens. Ed Markey and Richard Blumenthal both Democrats are sending a letter to 10 U.S. airlines asking the carriers "commit to providing a cash refund for all tickets that are canceled during the coronavirus pandemic." https://t.co/lOWowzsQn8  BETO O’ROURKE Beto O'Rourke on whether he plans to run for governor in 2022:"I'm going to think about where I can play the most positive role for Texas whether that's running for office or supporting those who do run for office. I'll think of any and all ways." https://t.co/M5guSeDo8W  Republican Rep. Adam Kinzinger said that he warned Kevin McCarthy that the Republican Party was courting violence in the days preceding the Capitol riot and was dismissed. https://t.co/Z2HbCSlkxN  KEVIN MCCARTHY Kevin McCarthy in writing to his colleagues and urging them to remove Liz Cheney as conference chair claims that Republicans "are a big tent party" and that "unlike the left we embrace free thought and debate." He is not being ironic.  BURKMAN & JACOB WOHL Jack Burkman and Jacob Wohl the conservative activists authorities allege organized thousands of robocalls aimed at discouraging voters ahead of the 2020 election have lost an appeal to toss the case against them Michigan AG Dana Nessel has announced. https://t.co/Wqje5kYZKl  MARYLAND Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan has granted posthumous pardons for 34 Black victims of lynchings in the state a sweeping action he said would be a step toward rectifying the killings of youths and men who were denied due process. https://t.co/qfNMsxcdPI  LOUISIANA A bill to extend early voting in Louisiana from seven to 10 days during presidential elections has been approved unanimously by a House committee. https://t.co/d6Yjs40tbI  CALIFORNIA California Gov. Gavin Newsom has proposed a $100 billion economy recovery package with the centerpiece a proposal to give $11.9 billion of direct cash payments to Californians. https://t.co/kv1fNC325l  ARIZONA The private company conducting the GOP recount in Arizona is now demanding access to government internet routers and passwords which the Maricopa County sheriff blasted as "mind-numbingly reckless and irresponsible" and a threat to law enforcement.https://t.co/gt9oASmqxF
